thread.title: Finalist in Kentucky pageant sets roommate's bed on fire: cops
thread.title_full: Finalist in Kentucky pageant sets roommate's bed on fire: cops

author: DAVID BOROFF
title: Finalist in Kentucky pageant sets roommate's bed on fire: cops
text:
Christen McAllister was charged with arson. (LMDC) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS  25 PM 
A finalist in the recent Miss Kentucky USA beauty pageant is accused of setting her roommate's bed on fire while at least two other people were home. 
University of Louisville student Christen McAllister, 22, had been arguing with her roommate before the alleged attack early Saturday morning, according to the arrest citation obtained by the Courier-Journal . 
McAllister gave a recorded confession to Louisville cops and was charged with first-degree arson. 
Two roommates were present at the off-campus apartment complex when the fire was started and alcohol may have been a factor, according to the Courier-Journal. 
GOP senators in Ky. want to ditch sexual harassment training 
McAllister finished fifth in the pageant last month after finishing in the top 15 the previous year. She wrote on a GoFundMe page raising money for the competition that the event "is a wonderful way to get involved with the community." 
"Through this experience I will be able to learn and absorb a great deal of information, which will carry on with me throughout my lifetime," she wrote. "If selected as Miss Kentucky USA, I will move on to represent my state through the plethora of opportunities provided, which will better prepare me for Miss USA 2017." 
She was able to raise her online goal of $2,500 to compete in the pageant.
